intro: Centaurium pulchellum subsp. morierei, commonly known as the Moriere's greenweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bright green flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological traits, including the structure of its calyx and corolla. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in many areas.
